title: Html Block & Inline
gp1: Every HTML element has a default display value, depending on what type of element it is.
gp2: There are two display values: block and inline.
gp3: A block-level element always starts on a new line, and the browsers automatically add some space (a margin) before and after the element.
gp4: A block-level element always takes up the full width available (stretches out to the left and right as far as it can).

wp1: An inline element does not start on a new line.
wp2: An inline element only takes up as much width as necessary.
wp3: The <div> element is often used as a container for other HTML elements.
wp4: The <div> element has no required attributes, but style, class and id are common.
wp5: The <span> element is an inline container used to mark up a part of a text, or a part of a document.
wp6: The <span> element has no required attributes, but style, class and id are common.
